channel.title: Leonardo Laguna Ruiz
channel.description: Recent content on Leonardo Laguna Ruiz

item.title: Blur Distortion
item.description: Blur is a distortion that I adapted from the Fuzz guitar pedal. Blur was one of the circuits I modeled for my VCV Rack module Flame.

item.title: Modules for VCVRack
item.description: This is a collection of all the modules that I have created for the virtual modular synthesizer VCVRack.

item.title: My CNC/3D printer
item.description: Some time ago I was helping my fiance’s family cleaning the basement and in there we found a box with many electric and mechanic components that belonged to her dad.

item.title: Monotron Eurorack Mod
item.description: More than six years after I bought my Korg Monotron, I decided to make a mod to put it in my Eurorack.

item.title: Vult Generic Module
item.description: This is a test module that I use to try different synthesis algorithms coded in Vult. The module uses a Teensy 3.2 and provides Eurorack voltages.

item.title: Steiner-Parker VCF
item.description: This is my version of a Steiner-Parker VCF for Eurorack format. This implementation is based on the design by Yves Usson (Yusynth).

item.title: Signal Buffer
item.description: This is a very simple module that I made to protect other signal generators just in case I make a mistake. A simple active buffer with a few operational amplifiers.

item.title: Talk at Technology Institute of Celaya
item.description: Last 9th of December I gave a talk at the Technology Institute of Celaya (Instituto Tecnológico de Celaya).

item.title: Vult at OpenFest Bulgaria
item.description: Last november I attended to the OpenFest 2016 in Bulgaria where I presented an overview of Vult.

item.title: Vult
item.description: Vult is a simple programming language made to generate high-performance DSP code that can run on small processors like Arduinos.

item.title: Using Arduinos as SystemModeler Components
item.description: This is a post in the Wolfram blog. It presents the ModelPlug library for SystemModeler.

item.title: Design and Optimization of Power Delivery and Distribution Systems Using Evolutionary Computation Techniques
item.description: This is my full PhD. thesis converted to HTML and presented as a single page.

item.title: Platform for fast evaluation and optimization of power systems
item.description: This is a short version of my thesis where I present the full platform.

item.title: Fast architecture generation and evaluation techniques for the design of large power systems
item.description: This paper focused in techniques used to automatically generate power architectures.

item.title: Power conversion modeling methodology based on building block models
item.description: Here I presented modeling methodologies to characterize power converters. In addition, I presented the tool to simplify capturing and generating models.

item.title: Generalized methodology for the analysis and design of multiphase converters with integrated magnetics
item.description: Here I presented the modeling and analysis of some cool magnetic core structures that I came up with.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m was born in Mexico in the state of Guanajuato. I got my first degree there, and later I moved to Spain to continue my studies. Currently live in Sweden where I work at Wolfram. I develop the simulation core of SystemModeler. In my free time I produce music and make software and hardware related to sound synthesis. You can find me in Linkedin at Leonardo Laguna Ruiz

item.title: Pla
item.description: Pla is an OCaml library and ppx syntax extension to create composable templates based on verbatim strings.

item.title: ModelPlug
item.description: ModelPlug is a library for SystemModeler. ModelPlug allows you to connect simulation models with Arduino boards and use them to input/output signals.

item.title: Other miscellaneous papers
item.description: More papers can be found in the IEEE Xplore by searching by author: “L. Laguna”.

item.title: Art & Tech Meetup
item.description: Last 20 of October we organized the first Art & Tech Meetup at Hackafe Plovdiv.

item.title: 3D Models
item.description: These are a few models that I have designed for different applications.

item.title: Creative Media Workshop
item.description: The Creative Media Workshop was a kind of Hackathon led by Barak Koren and Petko Tanchev.

item.title: Microbruto
item.description: The MicroBruto is a digital synthesizer with controllers inspired by the MicroBrute.

item.title: Mocotron
item.description: Mocotron is an imitation of the Monotron synthesizer made in Reaktor.

item.title: Monoblep-Meblitron
item.description: This is a hybrid synthesizer that I hacked during the MIDIHACK 2014 in Stockholm.

item.title: FirmataTest.js
item.description: This is a small program that I made to learn/test Atom-shell (now Electron) and Angular.js. This program allows you to communicate and configure Firmata boards like Arduino.

item.title: Ocaml Firmata
item.description: This is a Ocaml library that allows you to access Firmata boards.

item.title: Teensy Braids
item.description: I took the source code of the Mutable-Intruments Braids and adapted it to a Teensy board with a nice OLED display. Then I 3D-printed a case and made it a cool synthesizer.

item.title: HMH Mixer
item.description: This is an educational project I made to get a better understanding on mixing sound.

item.title: MeeBlip Editor
item.description: This is an editor for the Meeblip synthesizer. I use it with the Meeblip micro.

item.title: Water Bobot
item.description: I assembled this project using the Rover 5. It uses an Arduino for the low-level control (current balancing, speed control) and a Raspberry Pi to receive OSC messages.

item.title: Extendra
item.description: I made this board to add more I/O to other projects. It uses a PIC16F1516 and is controlled by I2C.

item.title: HackPrism
item.description: This is program inspired by the app SoundPrism. It does no have all the features of SoundPrism but it allows you hack the code and personalize it.

item.title: Noname Synth
item.description: This is a small synthesizer I made by reusing parts from other projects. Internally it has an XMOS processor and uses phase distortion synthesis.

item.title: QuineHp
item.description: This was the first programs that I made in the HP49G+ calculator using the C compiler (I have done many for the HP49G). It is a logic function minimizer using the Quine-MacCluskey method.
